title: Georgia school shooting suspect Colt Gray lived in several rental homes prior to the incident
content: Colt Gray, a 14-year-old suspect, along with his father Colin, faces charges for killing two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School in Georgia. The family had relocated multiple times after Colin's divorce. Colt struggled with bullying and his parents' separation. He is being tried as an adult for the incident.
summary: Colt Gray, a 14-year-old suspect, along with his father Colin, faces charges for killing two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School in Georgia. The family had relocated multiple times after Colin's divorce. Colt struggled with bullying and his parents' separation. He is being tried as an adult for the incident.

title: Prince Harry set to receive major inheritance after he turns 40. He will get ...
content: Prince Harry is set to receive around £8 million from a family trust fund on his 40th birthday, September 15. Established by his great-grandmother in 1994, the fund aims to provide financial gifts to her great-grandchildren. This financial boost adds to the couple's growing wealth from deals with Spotify, Netflix, and a book contract.
summary: Prince Harry is set to receive around £8 million from a family trust fund on his 40th birthday, September 15. Established by his great-grandmother in 1994, the fund aims to provide financial gifts to her great-grandchildren. This financial boost adds to the couple's growing wealth from deals with Spotify, Netflix, and a book contract.

title: US MQ-9 drone shot down by Houthis in Yemen's Marib governorate
content: The Iran-aligned Houthi group claimed responsibility for shooting down a US MQ-9 drone over Marib governorate, Yemen, alleging it was engaged in hostile activities. This incident aligns with ongoing Houthi attacks on shipping vessels in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden, as they demand an end to the Israel-Hamas conflict in Gaza.
summary: The Iran-aligned Houthi group claimed responsibility for shooting down a US MQ-9 drone over Marib governorate, Yemen, alleging it was engaged in hostile activities. This incident aligns with ongoing Houthi attacks on shipping vessels in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden, as they demand an end to the Israel-Hamas conflict in Gaza.

title: Georgia school shooting: How bullying and family struggles led to tragedy that killed four
content: A 14-year-old boy and his father face charges for a fatal shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia that killed four people. The case underscores the teenager's troubled home life, persistent bullying, and his father's role in giving him access to firearms. Both appeared in court for the first time in September 2023.
summary: A 14-year-old boy and his father face charges for a fatal shooting at Apalachee High School in Georgia that killed four people. The case underscores the teenager's troubled home life, persistent bullying, and his father's role in giving him access to firearms. Both appeared in court for the first time in September 2023.

title: In a first, Pakistan Army chief admits its direct role in 1999 Kargil war
content: Pakistan army chief General Asim Munir has admitted his military's direct involvement in the 1999 Kargil War against India, ending a long-standing claim that only indigenous Kashmiri rebels fought. He honoured Pakistani soldiers killed in the conflict and acknowledged their sacrifices in previous wars for the country and Islam.
summary: Pakistan army chief General Asim Munir has admitted his military's direct involvement in the 1999 Kargil War against India, ending a long-standing claim that only indigenous Kashmiri rebels fought. He honoured Pakistani soldiers killed in the conflict and acknowledged their sacrifices in previous wars for the country and Islam.

title: A street artist documents war in Ukraine, one stark mural at a time
content: Ukrainian street artist Gamlet Zinkivskyi joined a volunteer unit to defend Kharkiv but was advised by his commander to paint instead. His murals in bombed-out streets depict wartime realities and boost morale among soldiers and civilians. Despite widespread appreciation, some of his work has faced criticism for its themes.
summary: Ukrainian street artist Gamlet Zinkivskyi joined a volunteer unit to defend Kharkiv but was advised by his commander to paint instead. His murals in bombed-out streets depict wartime realities and boost morale among soldiers and civilians. Despite widespread appreciation, some of his work has faced criticism for its themes.

title: Pakistani man charged over alleged plot to attack New York City Jewish centre around October 7
content: Pakistani citizen Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, living in Canada, has been arrested for planning an attack on a Jewish center in New York City. Scheduled for October 2024, the attack aimed to kill as many Jewish people as possible in support of the Islamic State. Khan faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted.
summary: Pakistani citizen Muhammad Shahzeb Khan, living in Canada, has been arrested for planning an attack on a Jewish center in New York City. Scheduled for October 2024, the attack aimed to kill as many Jewish people as possible in support of the Islamic State. Khan faces up to 20 years in prison if convicted.

title: Georgia school shooting suspect was troubled by a broken family, taunting at school, his father said
content: Colin Gray and his teenage son Colt are charged with killing two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School. Colt is accused of murder, while Colin faces charges for supplying the weapon. The family struggled after an eviction led to separation a year earlier, affecting Colt's mental state.
summary: Colin Gray and his teenage son Colt are charged with killing two students and two teachers at Apalachee High School. Colt is accused of murder, while Colin faces charges for supplying the weapon. The family struggled after an eviction led to separation a year earlier, affecting Colt's mental state.

title: Military cooperation between Tehran and Moscow a threat to Europe, West Asia: Ukraine
content: Ukraine's foreign ministry has raised concerns about potential Iranian ballistic missile transfers to Russia, viewing it as a threat to Ukraine, Europe, and the Middle East. The ministry called for increased international pressure on both countries. Reports suggest that Iran has already transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia, heightening tensions in the ongoing conflict.
summary: Ukraine's foreign ministry has raised concerns about potential Iranian ballistic missile transfers to Russia, viewing it as a threat to Ukraine, Europe, and the Middle East. The ministry called for increased international pressure on both countries. Reports suggest that Iran has already transferred short-range ballistic missiles to Russia, heightening tensions in the ongoing conflict.

title: Hillary Clinton has advice on debating Donald Trump: 'He can be rattled'
content: Hillary Clinton, experienced in debating Donald Trump from the 2016 election, provides guidance to Kamala Harris for her debate strategy. Clinton highlights that Trump avoids direct answers and lacks specifics. She advises Harris to expose Trump's leadership flaws by making substantive attacks, which could create voter doubts about his stability.
summary: Hillary Clinton, experienced in debating Donald Trump from the 2016 election, provides guidance to Kamala Harris for her debate strategy. Clinton highlights that Trump avoids direct answers and lacks specifics. She advises Harris to expose Trump's leadership flaws by making substantive attacks, which could create voter doubts about his stability.

title: In rare move, heads of CIA, MI6 issue joint call for ceasefire in Gaza
content: CIA Director William Burns and MI6 Chief Richard Moore have called for a ceasefire in Gaza to de-escalate the Israel-Hamas conflict. They emphasised their intelligence efforts to broker peace and end civilian suffering. The chiefs also discussed global threats from Russia, China, and terrorism while praising Ukraine's resilience against Russian aggression.
summary: CIA Director William Burns and MI6 Chief Richard Moore have called for a ceasefire in Gaza to de-escalate the Israel-Hamas conflict. They emphasised their intelligence efforts to broker peace and end civilian suffering. The chiefs also discussed global threats from Russia, China, and terrorism while praising Ukraine's resilience against Russian aggression.

title: Major terror attack foiled, over 30 terrorists arrested in Punjab province of Pakistan
content: Law enforcement agencies in Punjab province of Pakistan have arrested 33 terrorists from various banned groups including Al-Qaeda and foiled a significant terror plot. The Counter Terrorism Department conducted 475 intelligence-based operations across different districts, interrogating suspects and recovering weapons and explosives. Cases have been registered against the detained individuals.
summary: Law enforcement agencies in Punjab province of Pakistan have arrested 33 terrorists from various banned groups including Al-Qaeda and foiled a significant terror plot. The Counter Terrorism Department conducted 475 intelligence-based operations across different districts, interrogating suspects and recovering weapons and explosives. Cases have been registered against the detained individuals.

title: Super Typhoon Yagi hits Vietnam: At least four killed amid widespread destruction
content: Super Typhoon Yagi struck northern Vietnam, leading to at least four deaths and extensive damage. The typhoon uprooted trees, displaced boats, and tore roofs off houses. In anticipation of the devastations, authorities evacuated thousands of residents to safer areas. Before hitting Vietnam, it left a trail of destruction in Southern China and the Philippines.
summary: Super Typhoon Yagi struck northern Vietnam, leading to at least four deaths and extensive damage. The typhoon uprooted trees, displaced boats, and tore roofs off houses. In anticipation of the devastations, authorities evacuated thousands of residents to safer areas. Before hitting Vietnam, it left a trail of destruction in Southern China and the Philippines.

title: Olympic rings to stay on Eiffel Tower until 2028: Paris mayor
Mexico arrests alleged drug boss linked to 43 missing students
content: A suspected drug cartel boss allegedly linked to the disappearance a decade ago of 43 college students was arrested in Mexico after being released from prison in 2019, authorities said Friday. In September 2014, the 43 students had been traveling to a political demonstration in Mexico City when investigators believe they were kidnapped by the drug cartel in collusion with corrupt police.
summary: A suspected drug cartel boss allegedly linked to the disappearance a decade ago of 43 college students was arrested in Mexico after being released from prison in 2019, authorities said Friday. In September 2014, the 43 students had been traveling to a political demonstration in Mexico City when investigators believe they were kidnapped by the drug cartel in collusion with corrupt police.

title: German rail system reports major disruptions due to a technical fault
content: Germany's national rail company reported significant disruptions on Saturday due to a technical disturbance affecting the satellite radio communications system. This led to many trains halting at stations, particularly around Frankfurt. The disruption impacted both long-distance and local services, including connections from Frankfurt's airport and main train station. Efforts are ongoing to fix the issue promptly.
summary: Germany's national rail company reported significant disruptions on Saturday due to a technical disturbance affecting the satellite radio communications system. This led to many trains halting at stations, particularly around Frankfurt. The disruption impacted both long-distance and local services, including connections from Frankfurt's airport and main train station. Efforts are ongoing to fix the issue promptly.

title: Michael Anthony Guider, convicted pedophile who killed schoolgirl Samantha Knight, dies in custody
content: Michael Anthony Guider, a convicted pedophile who murdered nine-year-old Samantha Knight and abused more than a dozen children, died in custody at age 73. Initially sentenced to 17 years, he was released in 2019 but re-arrested in 2022 for violating supervision conditions. Samantha's mother expressed anger over his release.
summary: Michael Anthony Guider, a convicted pedophile who murdered nine-year-old Samantha Knight and abused more than a dozen children, died in custody at age 73. Initially sentenced to 17 years, he was released in 2019 but re-arrested in 2022 for violating supervision conditions. Samantha's mother expressed anger over his release.

title: Russian army captures village in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region
content: Russian forces have taken control of Kalynove village in Ukraine's Donetsk region, according to the Russian Defence Ministry. This marks a significant advance in their offensive. In another incident, artillery shelling in Kostyantynivka killed three people and injured three others, causing damage to multiple buildings as the frontline approaches.
summary: Russian forces have taken control of Kalynove village in Ukraine's Donetsk region, according to the Russian Defence Ministry. This marks a significant advance in their offensive. In another incident, artillery shelling in Kostyantynivka killed three people and injured three others, causing damage to multiple buildings as the frontline approaches.

title: Watch: Ukraine deploys 'dragon drones' that drop molten metal on Russian forces
content: Ukraine has introduced 'dragon drones' that deploy thermite against Russian forces. Thermite burns at temperatures up to 4,000 degrees Fahrenheit and can incinerate almost anything. Historically used in both World Wars, this weapon raises issues regarding international humanitarian law due to its destructive capacity and potential for causing extensive environmental damage.
summary: Ukraine has introduced 'dragon drones' that deploy thermite against Russian forces. Thermite burns at temperatures up to 4,000 degrees Fahrenheit and can incinerate almost anything. Historically used in both World Wars, this weapon raises issues regarding international humanitarian law due to its destructive capacity and potential for causing extensive environmental damage.

title: Putin gifts Kim Jong-un 24 horses in exchange for artillery shells used in Ukraine war
content: Vladimir Putin has presented North Korean leader Kim Jong-un with 24 purebred Orlov Trotters as partial payment for artillery shells used in Russia’s ongoing conflict in Ukraine. This exchange is part of a continuing diplomatic tradition, highlighting North Korea's substantial investment in thoroughbred horses and their symbolic significance to Kim's regime.
summary: Vladimir Putin has presented North Korean leader Kim Jong-un with 24 purebred Orlov Trotters as partial payment for artillery shells used in Russia’s ongoing conflict in Ukraine. This exchange is part of a continuing diplomatic tradition, highlighting North Korea's substantial investment in thoroughbred horses and their symbolic significance to Kim's regime.
